MonsterTrait.Name: Innate Spellcasting
MonsterTrait.Text: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: disguise self, inflict wounds (4d10), message, ray of enfeeblement 1/day each: detect thoughts, dispel magic, lightning bolt, locate creature, shillelagh, stinking cloud, teleport

MonsterTrait.Name: Magic Resistance
MonsterTrait.Text: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

MonsterTrait.Name: Confounding Ugliness
MonsterTrait.Text: When confronting a mirror hag at any range, a creature must make a choice at the start of each of its turns: either avert its eyes so that it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag until the start of its next turn, or look at the hag and make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. Failure on the saving throw leaves the character stunned until the start of its next turn.

MonsterTrait.Name: Multiattack
MonsterTrait.Text: A mirror hag can use its Reconfiguring Curse and make one melee attack.

MonsterAction.Name: Bite
MonsterAction.Text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) piercing damage, or 39 (8d8 + 3) piercing damage against a stunned target.

MonsterAction.Name: Quarterstaff
MonsterAction.Text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

MonsterTrait.Name: Reconfiguring Curse
MonsterTrait.Text: The mirror hag curses a living creature within 60 feet, giving it beastly or hideous features. The target of the reconfiguring curse must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 Charisma damage. A successful save renders the target immune to further uses of that hag's curse for 24 hours.
